title: PBL Course for Strengthening Scientific Literacy to Solve Social Issues

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science concepts and awareness of social issues
context.additional_context: A blended PBL program for undergraduate elementary education majors aimed at fostering scientific literacy applicable to social studies education. Structured around role-playing and discussion activities reflecting real classroom environments.

learning_goals: Learners select three social issues occurring in the local community (e.g., waste sorting problems, conflicts over public facility usage) and apply the five stages of scientific inquiry (problem definition → hypothesis formulation → data collection → analysis → conclusion drawing) to create an analytical report. They must achieve a grade of 'B+' or higher in at least two of the three instructor evaluation criteria: clarity, logical coherence, and practicality.
Students develop decision-making and negotiation skills based on scientific evidence.
Students can propose solutions to science-society integrated problems through an interdisciplinary approach.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
